basics.name: Jun GAO
basics.label: Doctoral Researcher
basics.summary:
I am a doctoral researcher at the [University of Luxembourg](https://wwwen.uni.lu/) under the supervision of [Prof. Jacques Klein](https://jacquesklein2302.github.io/) and [Prof. Tegawendé F. BISSYANDE](https://bissyande.github.io/). My research topic is on the security of Android applications. The main tasks include: 1) Developing static analysis tools with mainly Java. 2) Mining tool reports for features, patterns, etc., with Python and relevant data analysis libraries (e.g., numpy, pandas, matplotlib). 3) Deploying investigations and analyses on [HPC](https://hpc.uni.lu/) for large scale study with Bash and Python script.

I received my M.S. degree in Communication Systems from [Royal Institute of Technology (KTH)](https://www.kth.se/en), Sweden, and will be granted a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science in Jan 2021. I have more than 7 years of professional experience in a few different technical sectors as well. These reflect my eagerness for various technologies and competency in efficient self-learning. I am open-minded and also a person of critical thinking and self-examination.

In my leisure time, I am a jogger and badminton player. I enjoy reading Sci-Fi novels, books on physics, mathematics, economics as well as history. I also do side projects on machine learning and microcontroller programming.

work.company: Kunming University of Science and Technology (KUST), China
highlights:
Campus network design and maintenance:
  • IP address configuration.
  • routing strategy design and implementation.
  • QoS strategy design and implementation.
  • Load balance configuration.
  • Routers, switches, WLAN, configuration.

Services setup and maintenance:
  • DHCP, DNS, email, WWW, RAID

Network Security setup & monitor:
  • Firewall configuration
  • IPSec VPN
  • IDS/IPS (Snort etc.) configuration and monitor
  • RADIUS configuration
